text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with pork recipe fell that's right
don't let this beautiful picture fool
you this recipe was not good but instead
of hiding my shame i've decided to show
you what happened and i'm doing that for
two very specific groups of fans the
first of which realize this is a great
learning experience learning from others
mistakes and the second group who get a
sadistic joy from watching other people
suffer and fail which is fine that's
basically why i watch c-span but anyway
here's what i did and here's what
happened so I started off by seasoning a
nice fully trimmed boneless pork loin
roast and of course that was with salt
and freshly ground black pepper on both
sides and then I went ahead and browned
it in a heavy-duty skillets with a
little bit of vegetable oil over high
heat which as you know is fairly
standard about to roast a big hunk of
meat procedure so I browned it up nicely
and at this point everything was looking
amazing I was pretty psyched and once it
was brown I removed it from the pan I
turned the heat down to medium and I
quickly tossed in a sliced shallot along
with a giant pinch of salt and some
butter and I proceeded to saute the
shallots on medium for a few minutes
until they started to turn translucent
and at that point I made my first of
several major errors I threw in some
rosemary but not a little rosemary a ton
of rosemary that was way too much
rosemary and did I realize it at the
time
no because watch this I added more and
to make things worse I'm actually giving
it a little saute in that hot fat which
is going to extract even more extra
rosemary flavor so basically my sauce
was ruined at this point but I didn't
know it so I went ahead and threw in my
whole green grapes which I've always
wanted to try roasting with some pork
actually saw it done with a whole fish
one time and I thought it looked pretty
cool so I stirred in a handful of whole
green grapes those are seedless of
course at that point I preheated my oven
to 325 I made a space and I returned my
nicely browned pork loin rose back to
the pan and then once that oven was hot
I went ahead and popped it in and cooked
it at 325 for about a half-hour 35
minutes or until reached an internal
temperature of about 140 145 and when we
took it out it looked like this and I
know it doesn't look that bad that's
what made this all so much worse and of
course we're always going to remove our
meat from the pan to let it rest while
we make our pan sauce so that's what we
did here and of course a piece of meat
that size you want to give it at least
at least 10-15 minutes to rest and while
that was happening we went back
over to the stove we put our pan back on
medium heat and as I was looking at this
getting ready to deglaze it I thought to
myself you know what this needs another
pinch of rosemary oh yeah
I inexplicably added more rosemary by
the way no I was not drunk making this
recipe I wish I had that excuse so I
stirred that in which brings us to my
next major mistake instead to deglaze
him with a nice rich chicken stock I
used water I got fooled by the Fond oh
yeah
fooled by the Fond i profoundly
overestimated how delicious and
flavorful all those caramelized shallots
and pan drippings at the bottom were I
figured that stuff was going to be so
flavorful that all I would need was a
little splash of water oh I was so wrong
anyway I stirred that in I soldiered on
I turned up the heat so we could reduce
it down like we always do for these kind
of pan sauces and is it reduced and as I
started tasting it I realized I had a
major issues not only was that rosemary
flavor killing everything else in the
sauce but above and beyond the rosemary
flavor the sauce was so flat so
one-dimensional I started to panic so I
ran to the fridge I threw in a little
splash of cream which totally made
things much better and by much better I
mean a lot worse I still had a really
flat one-dimensional sauce that all you
could taste was rosemary but now was
just slightly richer and more caloric
without improving the flavor at all but
anyway I continued reducing to an
appropriate consistency and since we
were hungry and I put in all this effort
into it I decided to serve it anyway so
I spooned that sauce over my pork which
by the way was cooked unbelievably
perfect and as I took the first bite
here I was thinking maybe you just
tasted the sauce so many times you just
think it's horrible so I took a bite and
I realized no that's not the case it
really was that bad borderline inedible
sauce but like I said the pork was
perfect and I was able to test my theory
that roasted whole green grapes would be
good with pork which it was except it
only was if you cut little pieces of
grape and ate it with the pork which
some of your lazier guests may not do so
we may have to rethink how we do the
grapes
anyway the grapes were a very minor
issue when you compare them to the major
major mistakes I made here in but anyway
time to wrap this up the
self-flagellation is exhausting so I
really hope you don't give this a try
head over to food wishes comm where
you'll see no ingredient in my
but you will see more info as usual and
as always enjoy
